trans-unit.source: Enable heap dumps for Hadoop services on HDInsight | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Enable heap dumps for Hadoop services on HDInsight | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Enable heap dumps for Hadoop services from Linux-based HDInsight clusters for debugging and analysis.
trans-unit.target: Enable heap dumps for Hadoop services from Linux-based HDInsight clusters for debugging and analysis.

trans-unit.source: Heap dumps contain a snapshot of the application's memory, including the values of variables at the time the dump was created.
trans-unit.target: Heap dumps contain a snapshot of the application's memory, including the values of variables at the time the dump was created.

trans-unit.source: So they are very useful for diagnosing problems that occur at run-time.
trans-unit.target: So they are very useful for diagnosing problems that occur at run-time.

trans-unit.source: The information in this article only applies to Linux-based HDInsight.
trans-unit.target: The information in this article only applies to Linux-based HDInsight.

trans-unit.source: For information on Windows-based HDInsight, see <linkText>Enable heap dumps for Hadoop services on Windows-based HDInsight</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: For information on Windows-based HDInsight, see <linkText>Enable heap dumps for Hadoop services on Windows-based HDInsight</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: You can enable heap dumps for the following services:
trans-unit.target: You can enable heap dumps for the following services:

trans-unit.source: hcatalog - tempelton
trans-unit.target: hcatalog - tempelton

trans-unit.source: hive - hiveserver2, metastore, derbyserver
trans-unit.target: hive - hiveserver2, metastore, derbyserver

trans-unit.source: mapreduce - jobhistoryserver
trans-unit.target: mapreduce - jobhistoryserver

trans-unit.source: yarn - resourcemanager, nodemanager, timelineserver
trans-unit.target: yarn - resourcemanager, nodemanager, timelineserver

trans-unit.source: hdfs - datanode, secondarynamenode, namenode
trans-unit.target: hdfs - datanode, secondarynamenode, namenode

trans-unit.source: You can also enable heap dumps for the map and reduce processes ran by HDInsight.
trans-unit.target: You can also enable heap dumps for the map and reduce processes ran by HDInsight.

trans-unit.source: Heap dumps are enabled by passing options (sometimes known as opts, or parameters) to the JVM when a service is started.
trans-unit.target: Heap dumps are enabled by passing options (sometimes known as opts, or parameters) to the JVM when a service is started.

trans-unit.source: For most Hadoop services, this can be accomplished by modifying the shell script used to start the service.
trans-unit.target: For most Hadoop services, this can be accomplished by modifying the shell script used to start the service.

trans-unit.source: In each script, there is an export for \*\_OPTS, which contains the options passed to the JVM.
trans-unit.target: In each script, there is an export for \*\_OPTS, which contains the options passed to the JVM.

trans-unit.source: For example, in the hadoop-env.sh script, the line that begins with export HADOOP_NAMENODE_OPTS= contains the options for the NameNode service.
trans-unit.target: For example, in the hadoop-env.sh script, the line that begins with export HADOOP_NAMENODE_OPTS= contains the options for the NameNode service.

trans-unit.source: Map and reduce processes are slightly different, as these are a child process of the MapReduce service.
trans-unit.target: Map and reduce processes are slightly different, as these are a child process of the MapReduce service.

trans-unit.source: Each map or reduce process runs in a child container, and there are two entries that contain the JVM options for these.
trans-unit.target: Each map or reduce process runs in a child container, and there are two entries that contain the JVM options for these.

trans-unit.source: Both contained in mapred-site.xml:
trans-unit.target: Both contained in mapred-site.xml:

trans-unit.source: mapreduce.admin.map.child.java.opts
trans-unit.target: mapreduce.admin.map.child.java.opts

trans-unit.source: mapreduce.admin.reduce.child.java.opts
trans-unit.target: mapreduce.admin.reduce.child.java.opts

trans-unit.source: We recommend using Ambari to modify both the scripts and mapred-site.xml settings, as Ambari will handle replicating changes across nodes in the cluster.
trans-unit.target: We recommend using Ambari to modify both the scripts and mapred-site.xml settings, as Ambari will handle replicating changes across nodes in the cluster.

trans-unit.source: See the <linkText>Using Ambari</linkText><title></title> section for specific steps.
trans-unit.target: See the <linkText>Using Ambari</linkText><title></title> section for specific steps.

trans-unit.source: The following option enables heap dumps when an OutOfMemoryError occurs:
trans-unit.target: The following option enables heap dumps when an OutOfMemoryError occurs:

trans-unit.source: The + indicates that this option is enabled.
trans-unit.target: The + indicates that this option is enabled.

trans-unit.source: The default is disabled.
trans-unit.target: The default is disabled.

trans-unit.source: Heap dumps are not enabled for Hadoop services on HDInsight by default, as the dump files can be large.
trans-unit.target: Heap dumps are not enabled for Hadoop services on HDInsight by default, as the dump files can be large.

trans-unit.source: If you do enable them for troubleshooting, remember to disable them once you have reproduced the problem and gathered the dump files.
trans-unit.target: If you do enable them for troubleshooting, remember to disable them once you have reproduced the problem and gathered the dump files.

trans-unit.source: The default location for the dump file is the current working directory.
trans-unit.target: The default location for the dump file is the current working directory.

trans-unit.source: You can control where the file is stored using the following option:
trans-unit.target: You can control where the file is stored using the following option:

trans-unit.source: For example, using -XX:HeapDumpPath=/tmp will cause the dumps to be stored in the /tmp directory.
trans-unit.target: For example, using -XX:HeapDumpPath=/tmp will cause the dumps to be stored in the /tmp directory.

trans-unit.source: You can also trigger a script when an OutOfMemoryError occurs.
trans-unit.target: You can also trigger a script when an OutOfMemoryError occurs.

trans-unit.source: For example, triggering a notification so you know that the error has occurred.
trans-unit.target: For example, triggering a notification so you know that the error has occurred.

trans-unit.source: This is controlled using the following option:
trans-unit.target: This is controlled using the following option:

trans-unit.source: Since Hadoop is a distributed system, any script used must be placed on all nodes in the cluster that the service runs on.
trans-unit.target: Since Hadoop is a distributed system, any script used must be placed on all nodes in the cluster that the service runs on.

trans-unit.source: The script must also be in a location that is accessible by the account the service runs as, and must provide execute permissions.
trans-unit.target: The script must also be in a location that is accessible by the account the service runs as, and must provide execute permissions.

trans-unit.source: For example, you may wish to store scripts in /usr/local/bin and use chmod go+rx /usr/local/bin/filename.sh to grant read and execute permissions.
trans-unit.target: For example, you may wish to store scripts in /usr/local/bin and use chmod go+rx /usr/local/bin/filename.sh to grant read and execute permissions.

trans-unit.source: To modify the configuration for a service, use the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To modify the configuration for a service, use the following steps:

trans-unit.source: Open the Ambari web UI for your cluster.
trans-unit.target: Open the Ambari web UI for your cluster.

trans-unit.source: The URL will be https://YOURCLUSTERNAME.azurehdinsight.net.
trans-unit.target: The URL will be https://YOURCLUSTERNAME.azurehdinsight.net.

trans-unit.source: When prompted, authenticate to the site using the HTTP account name (default: admin,) and password for your cluster.
trans-unit.target: When prompted, authenticate to the site using the HTTP account name (default: admin,) and password for your cluster.

trans-unit.source: You may be prompted a second time by Ambari for the user name and password.
trans-unit.target: You may be prompted a second time by Ambari for the user name and password.

trans-unit.source: If so, just re-enter the same account name and password
trans-unit.target: If so, just re-enter the same account name and password

trans-unit.source: Using the list of on the left, select the service area you want to modify.
trans-unit.target: Using the list of on the left, select the service area you want to modify.

trans-unit.source: For example, HDFS.
trans-unit.target: For example, HDFS.

trans-unit.source: In the center area, select the Configs tab.
trans-unit.target: In the center area, select the Configs tab.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Image of Ambari web with HDFS Configs tab selected</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Image of Ambari web with HDFS Configs tab selected</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Using the Filter... entry, enter opts.
trans-unit.target: Using the Filter... entry, enter opts.

trans-unit.source: This will filter the list of configuration items to only those containing this text, and is a quick way to find the shell script, or template that can be used to set these options.
trans-unit.target: This will filter the list of configuration items to only those containing this text, and is a quick way to find the shell script, or template that can be used to set these options.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Filtered list</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Filtered list</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Find the \*\_OPTS entry for the service you want to enable heap dumps for, and add the options you wish to enable.
trans-unit.target: Find the \*\_OPTS entry for the service you want to enable heap dumps for, and add the options you wish to enable.

trans-unit.source: In the following image, I've added -XX:+HeapDumpOnOutOfMemoryError -XX:HeapDumpPath=/tmp/ to the HADOOP\_NAMENODE\_OPTS entry:
trans-unit.target: In the following image, I've added -XX:+HeapDumpOnOutOfMemoryError -XX:HeapDumpPath=/tmp/ to the HADOOP\_NAMENODE\_OPTS entry:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>HADOOP_NAMENODE_OPTS with -XX:+HeapDumpOnOutOfMemoryError -XX:HeapDumpPath=/tmp/</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>HADOOP_NAMENODE_OPTS with -XX:+HeapDumpOnOutOfMemoryError -XX:HeapDumpPath=/tmp/</linkText>

trans-unit.source: When enabling heap dumps for the map or reduce child process, you will instead look for the fields labled mapreduce.admin.map.child.java.opts and mapreduce.admin.reduce.child.java.opts.
trans-unit.target: When enabling heap dumps for the map or reduce child process, you will instead look for the fields labled mapreduce.admin.map.child.java.opts and mapreduce.admin.reduce.child.java.opts.

trans-unit.source: Use the Save button to save the changes.
trans-unit.target: Use the Save button to save the changes.

trans-unit.source: You will be allowed to enter a short note describing the changes.
trans-unit.target: You will be allowed to enter a short note describing the changes.

trans-unit.source: Once the changes have been applied, the Restart required icon will appear beside one or more services.
trans-unit.target: Once the changes have been applied, the Restart required icon will appear beside one or more services.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>restart required icon and restart button</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>restart required icon and restart button</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select each service that needs a restart, and use the Service Actions button to Turn On Maintenance Mode.
trans-unit.target: Select each service that needs a restart, and use the Service Actions button to Turn On Maintenance Mode.

trans-unit.source: This prevents alerts from being generated from this service when you restart it.
trans-unit.target: This prevents alerts from being generated from this service when you restart it.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Turn on maintenance mode menu</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Turn on maintenance mode menu</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Once you have enabled maintenance mode, use the Restart button for the service to Restart All Effected
trans-unit.target: Once you have enabled maintenance mode, use the Restart button for the service to Restart All Effected

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Restart All Affected entry</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Restart All Affected entry</linkText>

trans-unit.source: the entries for the Restart button may be different for other services.
trans-unit.target: the entries for the Restart button may be different for other services.

trans-unit.source: Once the services have been restarted, use the Service Actions button to Turn Off Maintenance Mode.
trans-unit.target: Once the services have been restarted, use the Service Actions button to Turn Off Maintenance Mode.

trans-unit.source: This Ambari to resume monitoring for alerts for the service.
trans-unit.target: This Ambari to resume monitoring for alerts for the service.
